definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The flower plant has overgrown its support.
sentences.chinese: 盆养花长得极高，超出了支架。

sentences.english: At my spare time I also grow flowers.
sentences.chinese: 业余时间我还喜欢养花。

sentences.english: The climate of Beijing is not fit for growing flowers.
sentences.chinese: 北京的气候，对养花来说，不算很好。

sentences.english: Aviculture plant flowers in almost every household, life is full of fun.
sentences.chinese: 几乎家家户户都养花养鸟，生活充满情趣。

sentences.english: We bedded up the dirt for raising flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我们堆土成花坛以养花。

sentences.english: So. The plant is just practice for raising a child?
sentences.chinese: 那么说，养花是养孩子的练习啦？

sentences.english: She is particularly keep on nuturing the flowers.
At that time, my father very much like the flower-growing.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，我的父亲非常喜欢养花。

sentences.english: I love flowers, so I love to grow them.
He takes up gardening after his retirement.
sentences.chinese: 退休后他以养花种草作为消遣。

definition: to water the plants/to water the garden
fertilizer for potted flowers/fertilizer used to promote flowering in crop plants
